data: NICU Hypoglycemia Management
Status
This order set applies to infants with hypoglycemia requiring IV dextrose or increased Glucose Infusion Rate (GIR)
Refer to Hypoglycemia Algorithm: Infant Requiring IV Dextrose to Manage Acute Hypoglycemia
Patient Care
Blood Glucose Targets
Target Blood Glucose: 2.6 to 5 mmoL/L for infants age less than 72 hours
Blood Glucose Targets
Target Blood Glucose: 3.3 to 5 mmol/L for infants age greater than 72 hours
POC Glucose Whole Blood
q2h, and PRN for any symptoms of hypoglycemia
q3h, and PRN for any symptoms of hypoglycemia
q6h, and PRN for any symptoms of hypoglycemia
q12h, and PRN for any symptoms of hypoglycemia
Before bolus feeds and PRN for any symptoms of hypoglycemia
POC Glucose Whole Blood
30 minutes following each D10W bolus
POC Glucose Whole Blood
30 minutes after any change in Glucose Infusion Rate (feed or IV rate)
Monitor Intake and Output
q6h
Insert Arterial Catheter
T;N
Diet/Nutrition
NICU Nutrition (Module)
Order Parenteral Nutrition from Parenteral Nutrition band in PowerChart
Continuous Infusions

Consider Central Umbilical or PICC access if dextrose concentration after stabilization is greater than or equal to 15%. To order PICC access, select NICU Peripherally Inserted Central Catheter Insertion (Multiphase) PowerPlan
Total Fluid Intake Ped/Neo
Neo Total (mL/kg/day): 80, Including PO and Enteral Meds/Fluids Including IV Continuous Infusions/Fluids, Including IV Meds:
Neo Total (mL/kg/day): 100, Including PO and Enteral Meds/Fluids Including IV Continuous Infusions/Fluids, Including IV Meds:
Neo Total (mL/kg/day): 120, Including PO and Enteral Meds/Fluids Including IV Continuous Infusions/Fluids, Including IV Meds:
Administer intravenous dextrose 10% bolus if blood glucose less than 1.8 mmol/L. If Critical Sample is ordered, draw prior to administering dextrose 10%
dextrose 10% (D10W) bolus
2 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 15 minute, drug form: bag
If requiring additional D10W bolus doses, order through Quick Orders or choose any of the following:
dextrose 10% (D10W) bolus
2 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 15 minute, drug form: bag
dextrose 10% (D10W) bolus
2 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 15 minute, drug form: bag
dextrose 10% (D10W) bolus
2 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 15 minute, drug form: bag
Stabilization Phase
Initiate dextrose 10% IV infusion at lowest rate needed to achieve blood glucose in target range
dextrose 10% (D10W) continuous infusion
order rate: 80 mL/kg/day, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/kg/day, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 120 mL/kg/day, IV, drug form: bag
mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
dextrose 10%-sodium chloride 2.5 mmol/100 mL continuous infusion
order rate: 80 mL/kg/day, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/kg/day, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 120 mL/kg/day, IV, drug form: bag
mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
dextrose 10%-potassium chloride 2 mmol/100mL-sodium chloride 2.5 mmol/100mL continuous infusion
order rate: 80 mL/kg/day, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/kg/day, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 120 mL/kg/day, IV, drug form: bag
mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Maintenance Phase
Use concentrated dextrose solution as needed in order to achieve blood glucose in target range aiming for an infusion rate appropriate for postnatal age:

*- Suggested for required GIR less than 8.3 mg/kg/min, select dextrose 12.5% continuous infusion 
- Suggested for required GIR 8.3 to 10 mg/kg/min, select dextrose 15% continuous infusion  
- Suggested for required GIR greater than 10 mg/kg/min, select dextrose 20% continuous infusion
dextrose 12.5% (D12.5W) continuous infusion

Medications
Consider starting glucagon if required Glucose Infusion Rate (GIR) was greater than 12 mg/kg/min during glucose stabilization
NICU Glucagon Administration for the Management of Persistent Hypoglycemia (Module)
Consider diazoxide if persistent hypoglycemia despite glucagon, suspected hyperinsulinism or if clinically indicated. (Ensure patient is on oral feeds)
NICU Diazoxide Administration for Management of Persistent Hypoglycemia (Module)
Laboratory
Consider NICU Hypoglycemia Investigations including Suspected Hyperinsulinism (Critical Sample) (Module) if patient has two or more blood glucose below target
NICU Hypoglycemia Investigations including Suspected Hyperinsulinism (Critical Sample) (Module)
Consider choosing Electrolytes Urea Creatinine Panel if three or more D10W boluses required
Electrolytes Urea Creatinine Panel
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Calcium Ionized Whole Blood CWH
Whole Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Capillary Blood Gas
Whole Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Calcium Ionized Capillary
Whole Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Magnesium Level
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
CBC and Differential
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Consults/Referrals

Consider consultation with Endocrinology if any of the following:   
- If persistent hypoglycemia over 72 hours  
- If diazoxide use  
- If refractory hypoglycemia   
- If there are any concerns for endocrinopathy
